required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Efficacy and Safety of E2007 (Perampanel) Given as Adjunctive Therapy in Subjects With Refractory Partial Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Escalation, Parallel-Group Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of E2007 (Perampanel) Given as Adjunctive Therapy in Subjects With Refractory Partial Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of perampanel when given as an adjunctive therapy in subjects with refractory partial seizures.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in the 28-day Seizure Frequency From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
primary_outcome.description: Seizure frequency per 28 days was derived from the information recorded in the subject diaries.

secondary_outcome.description: The responder rate for the Full ITT Analysis Set from the maintenance LOCF (Last Observation Carried Forward). A responder was a subject who had a 50 percent or greater reduction in seizure frequency per 28 days from the Pre‑randomization phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in the 28-day Complex Partial Plus Secondarily Generalized Seizure Frequency From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent Change in the Seizure frequency per 28 days was derived from the information recorded in the subject diaries.

intervention.description: 2 mg perampanel or placebo in a 1:1:1:1 ratio, 170 subjects/arm, a total of 680 subjects. All subjects will take a maximum of 6 tablets daily and will be up-titrated weekly in 2-mg increments to their randomized dose.

4 mg perampanel or placebo in a 1:1:1:1 ratio, 170 subjects/arm, a total of 680 subjects. All subjects will take a maximum of 6 tablets daily and will be up-titrated weekly in 2-mg increments to their randomized dose.

8 mg perampanel or placebo in a 1:1:1:1 ratio, 170 subjects/arm, a total of 680 subjects. All subjects will take a maximum of 6 tablets daily and will be up-titrated weekly in 2-mg increments to their randomized dose.
Placebo in a 1:1:1:1 ratio, 170 subjects/arm, a total of 680 subjects. All subjects will take a maximum of 6 tablets daily.

facility.name: Samodzielny Publiczny Szpital Kliniczny nr 7 Slaskiego Uniwersytetu Medycznego w Katowicach
Pediatric Neurology Clinic of Emergency Children Hospital
Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry
Moscow Research Institute of Pediatrics and Pediatric Surgery

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo over 19-weeks (during 6-week Titration phase and 13-week Maintenance phase)

group.title: Perampanel 2mg
group.description: Perampanel 2mg daily over 19-weeks (during 6-week Titration phase and 13-week Maintenance phase)

group.title: Perampanel 4mg
group.description: Perampanel 4mg maximum daily dose (Titration from 2mg to 4mg daily over 6-weeks; Maintenance at 4 mg daily over 13-weeks)

group.title: Perampanel 8 mg
group.description: Perampanel 8mg maximum daily dose (Titration from 2mg to 8mg daily over 6-weeks; Maintenance at 8 mg daily over 13-weeks)

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: The number of participants started is not consistant with the number of Baseline Participants due to 6 participants who were randomized in the study, but not treated with study drug.

outcome.title: Percent Change in the 28-day Seizure Frequency From Baseline to the End of the Double-blind Phase (Titration and Maintenance Phases)
outcome.description: Seizure frequency per 28 days was derived from the information recorded in the subject diaries.
outcome.population: Full Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Analysis Set - group of subjects who were randomized to study drug, received study drug, and had any seizure frequency data during the Double-blind Phase.

reported_events.time_frame: From the time the subject signed the informed consent form to 30 days after the last dose of the study drug.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were assessed at clinical visits based on the subject's diary, vitals, weight, physical examination, neurological exam, and laboratory evaluations; and by telephone interviews/contact.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
